newsitem.title: USA: COMSAT seeks $20 mln in damages from ex-CEO.
newsitem.headline: COMSAT seeks $20 mln in damages from ex-CEO.

text.p: COMSAT Corp said Thursday it filed suit against its former chief executive, Bruce Crockett, alleging a conspiracy linking him with Herbert Denton, and two privately held firms which proposed a proxy contest with COMSAT .
The firms, Providence Capital Inc and Wyser-Pratte Inc, violated the Communications Satellite Act of 1962, COMSAT's suit charges.

The defendants' activities also allegedly violate a 1996 Termination Agreement in which Crockett agreed with COMSAT not to disparage, compete with or disclose confidential information about COMSAT to third parties.

COMSAT said that its directors, in order to implement a smooth restructuring of COMSAT back to its core communications business, agreed in a termination agreement to provide Crockett with payments and other benefits. In exchange, Crockett agreed not to injure the corporation by leaking confidential information, by joining with competitors or by disparaging the corporation and its leadership, the company said.
COMSAT alleges Crockett has violated those agreements, and said it now seeks over $20 million in damages and injunctive relief, against all defendants.
The defendants were not immediately available for comment.
